bibl.title: Letter from F. Bustinza to Philip Showalter Hench, June 8, 1949

div1.p: Bustinza seeks photographs of Reed and Lazear from Hench, for a book he is writing.

div1.head: Letter from F. Bustinza to Philip Showalter Hench, June 8, 1949
div1.opener:
dr in for
lots
PROF. DR. F. BUSTINZA
If Eckin affirms
I will do so
OK with me-
--J E
LABORATORIO DE FISIOLOGIA VEGETAL
(JARDÍN BOTÁNICO)
M A D R I D
Madrid 8 june I949
Professor Dr. Philip S. Hench.
Rochester.
Dear Professor. Hench.
div1.p:
Some time ago I received a reprint of your paper entitled
Walter Reed and the Conquest of yellow fever.

I must congratulate you for your very interesting work and for
puting clear the things that were wrong.

In I945 I made a voyage to the United States and I had the opor
tunity of visiting Habana in my voyage to Philadelphia.

I have the project of writing a book in relation with my voya
ge and when I will refer to Habana I will like to say a few wo
words in connection with Finlay and yellow fever. Will you please
authorise me to reproduce the phtograph of Walter Reed that you
published in your paper and will you also be so kind as to
send me a photograph of Dr. Lazear and at the same time authori-
se me to reproduce it in that book?.
With my gratitude for your help, I remain
